Class DisplayPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • DisplayPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class DisplayPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Displays the rods and the disks placed upon them
    Author:
    Tom Langwaldt
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • DisplayPanel

        private DisplayPanel()
        Constructor without parameters should never be called.

      • DisplayPanel

        public DisplayPanel(int rodCount,
                    int maxDiskAmount)
        Creates a JPanel which shows the rods and prepares the object to take draw tasks later. Sets the displayed height for the disks, so that the disks can potentially all visually fit onto one rod.
        Parameters:
        rodCount -
        maxDiskAmount -

    • Method Detail

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Responsible for displaying rods, step counter and disks on the displayPanel. Called every time the main frame is resized or repaint() is called on this panel.
        Overrides:
        paint in class javax.swing.JComponent

      • addDrawTask

        public void addDrawTask(int rod,
                        DrawDiskTask task)
        Save a draw task for a disk in this object, will be drawn, the next time paint() is called.
        Parameters:
        rod - Index of the rod starting with the leftmost rod having an index of 0.
        task - The task which will be added for the paint() method. Holds information about colour and size of the disk.

      • flushDrawTasks

        public void flushDrawTasks()
        Clear all draw tasks, so that new ones can be added in case the arrangement of the disks changes.

      • incrementStepCount

        public void incrementStepCount()
        Increase the step counter by +1.

      • resetStepCount

        public void resetStepCount()
        Set the step counter to 0.
